The air was still within the base. Cold and motionless. Unused sections we=
re usually kept cold so they made the base seem smaller when scanned. As fa=
r as the base security was concerned, it was locked up airtight. But the ph=
ysical reality did not reflect what was felt on the spark. Despite his cons=
cious mind resting he was still tied into the base's mainframe, and when he=
 heard, and felt, a call, much of the base suddenly sprang to life. 
=A0
Sc=
ans turned up nothing, completely secure. But he knew he heard something. T=
he recharge alcove lit up, light catching the new layer of then ice and fro=
st gathered on his frame. He connected his speech processors to the base's =
internal comm systems, hoping to catch this entity.
=A0
"I am Megatron, whe=
re and who are you? Why does a voice disturb me in my own fortress?" he dem=
anded, his recharge bay springing to life. It had prepared to disengage, se=
veral mechanisms primed to fire and literally eject him from the bay. A sec=
urity shutter that blocked the view from the alcove to the medical bay retr=
acted, allowing him to loock crosswise into the bay and see the console mon=
itoring his guest spark.

--- On Sat, 8/15/09, Lady Barbossa <MaximaSR74@ao=
l.com> wrote:


From: Lady Barbossa <MaximaSR74@...>
Subject: Re: Retur=
ning Home
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Date: Saturday, August 15, 2009, 7:52 =
PM


=A0 



Wandering aimlessly about as though seeking out something but =
with no success. It seemed to be searching for hours but the spark had no c=
oncept of time. 

As night fell upon the land, the spark returned like a pr=
odigal child to Megatron X's location, to where it found shelter and energy=
. 

Floating through the halls and corridors - some darkened, some not - li=
ke a ghost, it appeared almost as if to be exploring. But the light seemed =
to flicker and dim.

Finally the fiery spark returned to the chamber room w=
here it was being contained. Floating about the form that was still in cons=
ruction that would one day soon house the spark before returning to it's ho=
lding vat that nutured it and protected it. 
Within the containment, it set=
tled, floating there, slightly pulsing then stopped as it remained a steady=
 glow. 

Then a ghostly sweet reversed echo was heard, "Where are you?" it =
softly called, the tone sad and pain filled, as though alone. All alone. Bu=
t who was the voice was referring to or calling out to? 

> 
> 
> Even the =
mighty needed a respite, and Megatron X was no different. He had watched ov=
er the spark and the slow manufacture of it's new body. He had not gone far=
, now standing still in an alcove in a dark lightly room. Cables, hoses, an=
d clamps held him in place, replacing coolant in his systems, replenishing =
his energon and refueling his weapons. It was cold, his form now could as i=
ce with a low fog hangin over his form. 
> =A0
> It was after the stanger l=
eft that he notified. Still physically immobilized, his consciousness came =
online and accessed the base's internal and external security network. Scan=
s indicated the spark had competed it's body, and now had left. Odd, he not=
 think it would be able to do so. Perhaps it knew his security codes, or si=
mply broke out. Switching to external sensors, he scanned all of the island=
 of Hokkaido for signs of his guest.
> --- On Sat, 8/8/09, Lady Barbossa <M=
aximaSR74@ ...> wrote:
> 
> 
> From: Lady Barbossa <MaximaSR74@ ...>
> Subj=
ect: Re: Returning Home
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com
> Date: Saturday, Aug=
ust 8, 2009, 12:52 AM
> 
> 
> =A0 
> 
> 
> 
> > > =A0
> > > "Arise, stand s=
trong again, warrior. Heed the call of Megatron."
> > > 
> > 
> > What soun=
ded like whispers for but a moment, broke away to silence. Then a ghostly r=
everse echo that whispered and barely heard. Soon enough was well heard. 
>=
 > 
> > "Megatron?" the femme voice replied almost in disbelief. 
> > The s=
park pulsed a moment as though it were contemplating or something else. But=
 definitely feeding off the energon. 
> > "I am most grateful for the energ=
on and the rescue." That calm deep femme voice stated. "And honored to once=
 again be in thy presense, oh, mighty Megatron." Her voice sincere to every=
 degree. There was only one whom she respected 100%... and that was Megatro=
n. 
> > "I am forever in your debt." 
> > 
> > The spark hummed with light,=
 brilliant and glowing, sparks of controlled energy in gold and blue. Glowi=
ng like a star in the heavens.
> >
> 
> Silence overtook the vicinity once =
more. Darkness and silence. Not that it was a bad thing... but it wasn't a =
good thing either. 
> The spark pulsed from time to time, feeding off the e=
nergy that was offered to it, recovering. 
> It had recovered enough streng=
th for the time being. Some sparks recalled past memories. It took some tim=
e, but this particular spark was able to recall much. The last moments it w=
as functioning or alive was as some predacon to assasinate someone. And a n=
ame, a face, a sensation seemed to reverberate causing the spark to pulse.
=
> 
> Nearby the spark, a chassis was being constructed. A large one. One ne=
arly the height of the original Megatron. As drone parts worked furiously u=
pon the chassis, the spark pulsed moreso. The containment that held it, nur=
tured it, opened and out floated the spark. 
> 
> Like a ghost, it wandered=
 about before leaving the facility. For the time being, the spark had forgo=
tten about it's rescuer. But it would return. Soon or eventually.
>







=
